Macro Definition Documentation

◆ timer_expired

#define timer_expired (   timerptr)     timestamp_passed(timer_timestamp_stop(timerptr))

Check if timer expired.

Checks if timer expired. Timer will expire as soon as the time span provided with timer_start is elapsed.

Parameters
[in]timerTimer instance to check
Returns
true if timer expired, false otherwise

Function Documentation

◆ timer_reset()

void timer_reset ( myos_timer_t *  timer)

Resets a previously set timer.

Adds the currently set timespan to the timers start time.

Parameters
[in]timerTimer instance to reset

◆ timer_restart()

void timer_restart ( myos_timer_t *  timer)

Restarts a previously set timer.

Restarts a previously set timer. Be aware of that the timer must have been set properly before, otherwise behaviour is undefined.

Parameters
[in]timerTimer instance to restart

Definition at line 65 of file timer.c.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ timer_start()

void timer_start ( myos_timer_t *  timer,
timespan_t  span 
)

Starts a timer using a time span.

Timer will expire as soon as the time span elapsed. If the timer is running yet, the timer gets reinitialized with the new parameters provided. Any information about the previous timer setting gets lost.

Parameters
[in]timerTimer instance to set
[in]spanTime span to wait to elapse
